title: 111_s1735
content: The "Lumbee Recognition Act" is the short title of this legislation. The Act of June 7, 1956 is amended to acknowledge the Lumbee Indians of North Carolina as descendants of coastal tribes, recognized by the State since 1885 and by Congress in 1956. The Lumbee Indians should be granted full Federal recognition as an Indian tribe, along with the benefits, privileges, and immunities that come with this status. The Lumbee Indians should be granted full Federal recognition as an Indian tribe. The Act of June 7, 1956 is amended to extend Federal recognition to the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina. Laws and regulations applicable to Indians and Indian tribes will apply to the Lumbee Tribe and its members. Other groups of Indians in certain counties in North Carolina may petition for tribal acknowledgment. The Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina and its members are eligible for services and benefits provided to federally recognized tribes. Members residing in specific counties are considered to be on or near an Indian reservation. The Secretaries of the Interior and Health and Human Services will determine the needs of the Tribe after verifying a tribal roll. The Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina's service population will be defined by the tribal roll verified by the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary may take land into trust for the Tribe, with restrictions on gaming activities. The Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina is restricted from conducting gaming activities under federal law or regulations. The State of North Carolina has jurisdiction over criminal offenses and civil actions on lands owned by the tribe. The Secretary of the Interior can accept transfers from the state on behalf of the United States. The Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina may transfer jurisdiction to the United States, subject to an agreement with the State of North Carolina. This transfer would not take effect until 2 years after the agreement. This section does not impact the Indian Child Welfare Act. Appropriations are authorized for implementing this Act.
